title: Pasta and Seafood
creditsText: Foodista.com – The Cooking Encyclopedia Everyone Can Edit

extendedIngredients.name: plum tomatoes
extendedIngredients.original: 2 cups Canned plum tomatoes drained, and

extendedIngredients.name: squid ink linguine or
extendedIngredients.original: 1/2 pound Dried squid ink linguine or 1/4 cup Extra-virgin olive oil
extendedIngredients.originalName: Dried squid ink linguine or 1/4 cup Extra-virgin olive oil

summary: Pastan and Seafood is a gluten free, dairy free, paleolithic, and primal main course. One serving contains 1147 calories, 25g of protein, and 115g of fat. For $4.84 per serving, this recipe covers 23% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. This recipe serves 2. Head to the store and pick up pepper, garlic clove, shrimp, and a few other things to make it today. It is brought to you by Foodista. 1 person has tried and liked this recipe. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes around 45 minutes. With a spoonacular score of 69%, this dish is solid. Try Seafood Pasta, Seafood Pasta, and Seafood Pasta for similar recipes.
instructions:
1. Bring water to a boil for pasta. Cook for 10 minutes or until al dente. In one saucepan heat half of the olive oil. Add garlic and saute for a few seconds. Add tomatoes and cook for 5 minutes or until thickened; season with salt and pepper.
  2. In another skillet cook the shrimp in half the remaining olive oil. Remove from heat and toss in the parsley; season with salt and pepper. Drain pasta and transfer to a serving bowl; add shrimp and tomato mixtures and toss; do not serve with cheese.
  3. This recipe yields 2 servings.

steps.step: Bring water to a boil for pasta. Cook for 10 minutes or until al dente. In one saucepan heat half of the olive oil.
Add garlic and saute for a few seconds.
Add tomatoes and cook for 5 minutes or until thickened; season with salt and pepper.In another skillet cook the shrimp in half the remaining olive oil.
Remove from heat and toss in the parsley; season with salt and pepper.
Drain pasta and transfer to a serving bowl; add shrimp and tomato mixtures and toss; do not serve with cheese.This recipe yields 2 servings.
